This 2016 Ferrari California T comes equipped loaded with features such as: Homelink, Bluetooth, Yellow Ferrari Brake Calipers, Yellow RPM Tachometer, Sport Exhaust Pipes, Carbon Ceramic Brakes, Carbon Fiber Steering Wheel with LEDs, Daytona Style Front and Rear Seats with Blue Stitching and Black Alcantara Seat Inserts, Horse Stitched in Front Headrests in Blue, Foldable Rear Seat Backrests, Scuderia Fender Shields, F1 Transmission, Front and Rear Parking Sensors, SiriusXM Satellite Radio (Subscription Required), Xenon Headlamps, 20-Inch Forged Dark Painted Rims, Tire Pressure Monitor, Special Ordered Paint Color in Blu Mediterraneo, Plus Much More! This Front Engine, 2016 California T boasts Ferraris new 3.9L Twin-Turbocharged, V8 Direct Fuel Injected Engine, which produces approximately 550hp and 557Lb-Ft Torque! The 60mph mark is achieved in approximately 3.3 seconds, making the California T one of the most-powerful series production Ferrari road cars! The top speed on this collectible Ferrari is a sweltering 196 MPH! In addition to unbelievable power, this 2016 Ferrari California T needs only approximately 162ft to stop from 70 Mph! The Ferrari California was first introduced in 2009 and is full of firsts: It's the first-ever front-mounted V8-engined Ferrari, it's the first use of direct injection in a Ferrari, and it's Ferrari's first dual-clutch automated F1 transmission! The Ferrari California is the first Ferrari Gran Turismo with a mid-front 8-cylinder engine, a vehicle that uncompromisingly combines sportiness with versatility, guaranteeing the maximum driving pleasure characteristic of cars from Maranello. The Ferrari California is a convertible GT with retractable hard-top, making it a car with a dual soul: Coupe and Spider rolled into one! It is based on the original 2+ concept, which provides great flexibility for use in different driving conditions! While the Ferrari California is an extremely innovative car, its philosophy recalls the spirit of a great Ferrari from the past, the 250 California of 1957. This was a car of rare elegance, a car born to race, that has since become a symbol not only of sportiness and innovation, but also of exclusivity, craftsmanship and great refinement! This 2016 Ferrari California T is one of the nicest examples of its kind and will be a must have masterpiece for any true car enthusiasts collection! Please contact our experienced sales team. About Ferrari of Tampa Bay Since 2008 Ferrari of Tampa Bay has been proudly serving the most discerning car buyers throughout Floridas Gulf Coast. With completion of a total remodel in 2017, our dealership fully embodies the excitement of the prancing horse. Tour our new showroom to fully experience our phenomenal collection of new and vintage Ferraris. The atelier at Ferrari of Tampa Bay is modeled after the original factory atelier in Maranello. Clients can relax with an espresso while configuring their dream vehicle right in the dealership. Ferrari of Tampa Bay is home to a fully viewable, state-of-the-art service facility that features nine service bays and factory-trained technicians, dedicated to taking pristine care of your Ferrari. Our ownerships unmatched Ferrari expertise coupled with decades-long experience restoring one-of-a-kind, multi-million dollar automobiles make Ferrari of Tampa Bay an easy choice when selecting a Ferrari dealer. From special events, to our Ferrari Challenge racing team to our staff and facilities, new prospects will find that the heart of our dealership is a passion that our customers recognize and that undoubtedly, sets Ferrari of Tampa Bay apart. About BJ Motors BJ Motors began as a passion for collecting fine automobiles and turned the enthusiasm and passion turned into a business that has thrived for over 25 years. Over 30 years of combined experience in selling some of the finest classic, sports, and exotic cars in the country. We are the largest pre-owned Dodge Viper in the country and loves other American brands as the Ford GTs for our main vehicle of choice. Our founder worked hard while spending time traveling all of the country racing Dodge Vipers and creating a network for obtaining the nicest, cleanest lowest mileage Vipers and Ford GTs in the market place. You can imagine the excitement of our typical day deciding which car to take out for a drive; whether it be a 600 hp Dodge Viper, or a 550 horsepower Ford GT, Lamborghini or Saleen S7! We have the right vehicle for you. Whatever your choice, you can be assured we have done our homework and stand behind the inventory we offer for sale. We have gone through each car with a fine tooth comb and have spent hours detailing our cars from top to bottom in order to ensure your satisfaction is guaranteed, reliability is bulletproof,and great looks are certain. It is our goal to make your purchase a great experience and also to make your dreams come true. BJ Motors is one of the areas largest performance and exotic sports car wholesalers in Houston, Texas, and specializes in the Dodge Vipers, Ford Gts. Lamborghinis. We offer a variety of financing options, and extended warranties through our business partners, enclosed nationwide shipping, and owners that are friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Give us a call or schedule an appointment to come and see our line of fine vehicles just waiting for you! We would like to be your source for any exotic vehicles in the market place today. With the majority of the depreciation out of the newer cars we sell, performance vehicles continuing to go up in value, and the fact that we would love to have our own cars back when something else catches your eye, you can see why it costs so little to own one. It is our goal to buy and sell the best of the best automobiles. Each and every car is hand picked for extremely high quality with low mileage. Each car is as important to us as it is to you. Every vehicle is inspected prior to purchasing it for our inventory. We take extra care to research the history and service of each of our cars, as well as conduct a complete and thorough detail process. Because we are certain that you will be pleased with your purchase, we offer the right of inspection before purchase. It is important to us that you have the option to inspect and approve the automobile before taking ownership, therefore this is offered to you before final payment is received. Check out our Inventory www.bjmotors.biz as it changes daily. If there is something you are looking for specifically and you do not see it here, please send us an e-mail and we will try and help you locate your vehicle. Thanks for visiting and check back often. Also ask about our NO hassle consignment or if you are looking to sell your car we buy all makes and models. Contact us now at 833-526-3638 for more details! We at LAC are happy to be partnered with this company that offers personal and corporate leasing options to maximize your tax options. Here at LAC Scottsdale, we routinely ship vehicles across the nation, so we have an excellent network of experienced transport companies that can deliver on-site directly to you. We offer both open-air as well as enclosed shipping, so whether you’re looking to ship the Mercedes-Benz or even the Rolls-Royce you’re purchasing, we have the shipping options and solutions to ensure that your new purchase arrives safely, right to your door! Description: ﻿ 877-582-7218 Visit eBay Store ✕ Image 1/45 Image 2/45 Image 3/45 Image 4/45 Image 5/45 Image 6/45 Image 7/45 Image 8/45 Image 9/45 Image 10/45 Image 11/45 Image 12/45 Image 13/45 Image 14/45 Image 15/45 Image 16/45 Image 17/45 Image 18/45 Image 19/45 Image 20/45 Image 21/45 Image 22/45 Image 23/45 Image 24/45 Image 25/45 Image 26/45 Image 27/45 Image 28/45 Image 29/45 Image 30/45 Image 31/45 Image 32/45 Image 33/45 Image 34/45 Image 35/45 Image 36/45 Image 37/45 Image 38/45 Image 39/45 Image 40/45 Image 41/45 Image 42/45 Image 43/45 Image 44/45 Image 45/45 See Full Size Photos View Full Size Images 2001 Ferrari 550 Maranello 5.5L V12 6-speed Manual Stock #: 550M Exterior Color: Tour De France blue Interior Color: Tan Body Type: Coupe Transmission: 6-speed Manual Drivetrain: RWD Fuel Type: Gasoline Engine: 5.5L V12 Title Condition: Clear Vehicle Description This particular Ferrari 550 Maranello, Chassis number ZFFZS49A410123565, is a 2001 model year with 24,765 miles from new. It is fitted with a desirable 6-speed manual transmission and is finished in Tour De France Blue with a tan leather interior. While exact ownership history is not known we do know that the car was delivered new by Ferrari Maserati of Ft Lauderdale. It later passed through 2 more owners in TX and IL before staying with it’s most recent owner... since 2010. During that ownership it appears a major belt service was carried out in 2012 and since minor services have been completed along the way. While the car runs and drives well, by time, it is recommended by Ferrari that the car receive another major service in the near future. This car would best be described as a driver quality example. While it remains a striking piece of Italian machinery with fairly low miles, it has numerous small blemishes and imperfections that could be corrected should the new owner desire.EXTERIORBody & PaintThe Tour De France blue paint is absolutely stunning in person and is fairly smooth and consistent throughout. The finish of the paint, however, shows many signs of usage. The front of the car has numerous small stone chips from every day driving. There is some scuffing present on the front bumper and the front lip is a bit scraped up and has some stone chips in it. The rear bumper is in similar condition with some chipping and minor scuffing. Both rocker panels have minor stone peppering on them as well. The mirrors have some minor peppering from stones. There is also some chipping on the edges of the doors, more than likely from careless opening incidents. The door handle areas are slightly scratched up from normal usage and black painted cowl at the bottom of the windshield has some stone chips and flaking paint. Body panel gaps are respectable and straight with possibly a bit of ill fitment in places such as the rear bumper. The body panels themselves are smooth and straight, showing no major dents or dings.Glass & TrimThe glass appears to be all the correct type with proper Ferrari Sigla stampings on each of the panes. The windshield has some very minor pitting from stones but the rest of the glass remains clean and clear. The headlights, like the rest of the front end, show signs of usage with pitting, small scratches and a minor bit of haze. The front fog lights and taillights, however, are all clean and clear. Many of the painted trim surfaces are showing their age and the paint is chipped, faded and wearing, especially around the passenger window. The rubber trim around the passenger headlight has become loose towards the front edge and the fitment is off however the driver side remains supple and tight.WheelsThe wheels were more than likely refinished at some point as the painted surfaced are smooth and consistent with no curbing or rubbing, not entirely consistent with the clear usage present on the rest of the car. The center caps are brand new, having been replaced with OEM pieces. The mounting hardware is in good condition with no oxidation or damage present. Ferrari brand valve stem caps are in place.Notable FlawsThe exterior surfaces of the car show significant signs of usage. The front has many small stone chips and there is fading and cracked paint on trim surfaces. INTERIORSeats & SurfacesThe tan leather interior compliments the exterior color superbly. The overall condition mimics the exterior with signs of wear and usage present throughout. The driver’s side door card is in good shape but there is some discoloration where one’s elbow would rub on the door card. Both seats show a bit of wear around the bolsters and edges with minor sagging and creasing. The driver seat stitching has come undone near the upper portion and padding is visible poking through. The rear parcel shelf is in good shape with clean and tight leather and only minor signs of age in the form of a bit of creasing in spots. The buckle straps appear to have seen very minimal usage as they are in great condition. The carpets in the cabin are worn in high traffic areas with some staining present throughout. The steering wheel has some minor imperfections from normal usage. The dash and accent leather are finished in blue compliment the exterior of the car. The dash is relatively clean and smooth with only some minor pulling occurring around the top instrument cluster. The headliner is finished in quilted patterned leather similar to the rear parcel shelf and is tight and clean. There is a set of aftermarket speakers installed near the door jams, finished in complimenting tan leather with the rest of the interior which could be kept or removed easily at the discretion of the new owner. Some of the plastic surfaces display fading and light peeling (such as the air vents) but overall the interior is essentially free from the dreaded “stick bits” that plague Ferraris of this era.Functionality & AccessoriesAll switches and gauges appear to function as they should, however, some of the surfaces do show signs of wear and usage. The air vents, in particular, have some fading and flaking of the surfaces around their edges. The power seats function as they should and the windows power up and down with ease.Notable FlawsThe driver’s side seat has some stitching that has separated towards the top edge. The carpets are faded and have some staining present. Some of the interior plastic surfaces have flaking paint, fading, and signs of usage. ENGINE BAY, TRUNK, UNDERSIDEEngine BayThe engine bay appears like much of the rest of the car with signs of usage but in relatively good condition. The entirety of the engine bay could stand to receive a good detail which would help it to clean up nicely. Painted surfaces are relatively smooth and consistent. Black plastic surfaces are in good condition with some minor fading present in some spots. the metal intake and valve covers have a slight yellow hue to them, likely from normal usage, dirt and heat. All rubber hoses and wires appear in good condition with no cracking or worn components present upon inspection. The fire pad under the hood is in good condition with no major wear or discoloration.TrunkThere is an amp in the trunk to power the aftermarket speakers located in the cabin as well as a 6-disc cd changer, both properly mounted. The carpeting in the trunk is clean and free of major wear or staining.UndersideThe underside of the car shows signs of usage with the black plastics having some scuffs and scrapes. Wheel wells are a little dirty but in overall good order. There are no signs of any issues such as leaks etc.Notable FlawsOther than an aftermarket amp being mounted in the trunk there are no notable issues.MECHANICALSEngineThe engine fires right to life with a turn of the key and settles into a smooth idle. It makes good power with no flat spots or stumbling to speak of. It revs freely and sounds excellent even through the stock exhaust.TransmissionThe clutch take-up and engagement feel great. The shifter moves through its gated slots with no issues and the transmission engages all gears with no issue. It holds good powers and revs freely.Brakes & SuspensionThe brake pedal feels properly firm and reassuring. The cars comes to a smooth and controlled stop with no chatter or noises to note. The suspension feels compliant and responsive and there is no odd noises or excessive body roll to speak of.TiresThe tires are BF-Goodrich g-force T/A on all four corners. They are relatively new and have plenty of treadle left in them with no signs of aging. Contact us now at 877-582-7218 for more details! The car starts right up every time with no hesitation and that naturally aspirated mid-mounted... V8 is as smooth as a sewing machine.  Shifting through the gears with the F1 semi-automated manual transmission is satisfying, and acceleration is effortless thanks to the 503 HP and 350 lb-ft of torque.  All that power propels the F430 to 60 from 0 in just 3.6 seconds all the way to a top speed of 198 MPH.  This vehicle comes with all of its original documents, manuals, and accessories as well.  The power convertible top functions perfectly as does all the interior switches, buttons, and gauges.  This car was garage kept and well taken care of and is ready for a new home.  We invite you to our showroom in sunny West Palm Beach, FL to see this vehicle.Financing, Warranties and Shipping:Lusso Motorsports specializes in handling every aspect of the vehicle purchasing process starting at financing your new pre-owned vehicle to securing aftermarket warranties and final delivery of your new vehicle. Our Finance Department can assist you in securing financing for your vehicle through one of our many in-house financing options or we can assist you in obtaining third party financing. Lusso Motorsports has strong relationships and we are committed to identifying the perfect car loan company to suite your vehicle finance needs. At Lusso Motorsports we want to protect you and your investment. Our team can assist you in identifying and securing an aftermarket warranty for your new vehicle that will give you piece of mind for many smiles and many miles!We also have a full service department that caters to your vehicle’s every need, including general service, performance upgrades, window tint, vinyl wraps, professional detailing services, and much more!Upon acquisition of your new vehicle, the delivery coordinators at Lusso Motorsports can help to arrange shipping Nationwide through one of our many shipping partners or an in-person pickup in our showroom in Palm Beach County, FL. Description: prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next Vital Information Year Make Model Mileage 1966 Ferrari 330GT 2+2 Series 1 29,532 Exterior Interior Stock # VIN Unknown Color P7515 7515 Engine V12 View All Photos Description 1966 Ferrari 330GT 2+2 Series 1 Welcome to Crave Luxury Auto, one of the nation's premier marketers of high-line and luxury automobile dealers. The winner of this auction will have the opportunity to own this beautiful 1966 Ferrari 330GT 2+2 Series 1. The paint is in excellent condition and it is apparent that this car was garaged and meticulously-maintained. The interior is virtually flawless and is equipped with all the right options showing 29,532 miles. You can't go wrong with this fabulous vehicle! This 330GT 2+2 Series 1 is one of only 625 examples, matching numbers engine, Sympathetic restoration completed in 2015.300php, 3,967 cc SOHC V12 engine with three weber carburetors, 5-speed manual transmission, independent front suspension with unequal length A-arms and coil springs, live rear axle with semi-elliptical leaf springs and parallel trailing arms and 4 wheel disc brakes.Introduced at the Brussels motor show of January 1964, Ferrari's 330 GT 2+2 was the replacement for the outgoing 250 GT 2+2, and it notably elevated the prior four-seat platform with advanced mechanical elements and improved aesthetics. Most importantly, the one model received a larger and more powerful version of the Colombo short block engine that displaced 4.0 liters and was good for 300 HP. Factory driver Mike Parkes was a key contributor to the 330's development, even claiming credit for the eye-catching dual headlamp front fascia. Single headlamps were adopted with the succeeding second series cars that appeared in min 1965 leaving just 625 examples that were built with the double lamp design. Chassis number 7515 claims an unusual identity as one of very few transition cars that share features of the first and second series 330GT models. As one of the final series 1 examples built, this car is clothed in Pininfarina's handsome dual headlight body style, complete with knock-off borrani whire wheels. Mechanically, the 330 is equipped with some more developed features from the second series cars, including suspended pedals rather than a floor mounted pedal box and a 5 speed gearbox rather than a 4 speed with overdrive. this latter component endows chassis number 7515 with particularly long legs for extended high-speed cruising, a highly desirable attribute in a true GT car. According to a history by marque historian Marcel Massini, this 330 2+2 was completed at the actory in July 1965 (Equipped with air conditioning) and delivered new to Luigi Chinetti Motors. By 1973, the car was owned by Ewing Hunter, a Co-owner of FAF motorcars in Tucker, Georgia, the well-known dealership that was one of the collectible Ferrari Hobby's earliest American institutions. Passing to a chain o Illinois based caretakers in the early 1980's this 330 was owned by collector John Weinberger in 1987, by which time it had been repainted in Rosso. in 1992, while displaying just 25k original miles, the Ferrari was offered by esteemed collector Steve Levy of Riverwoods, Illinois.The minimally driven 330 GT 2+2 was treated to a sympathetic restoration that provided a clutch overhaul, new motor mounts, and master cylinder, rebuilt carburetors, new belts and hoses, and a partial rebuild of the engine with new piston rings, rod bearings, and valve guides. The paint and interior continue to present quite well, having been restored under a recent prior caretaker.Currently displaying approximately 29,523 miles which are believed to be original, chassis number 7515 is a beautifully restored example of the handsome first series 330GT. it would strongly complememt any collection of touring sports cars and also provides a good entry to the hobby as a model that is almost certain to appreciate in coming years. Description: prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next prev next Vital Information Year Make Model Mileage 1999 Ferrari 355 Fiorano Spider 16,545 Exterior Interior Stock # VIN Nero Burgandy P116267 ZFFXR48A9X0116267 Engine View All Photos Description 1999 Ferrari 355 Fiorano Spider Welcome to Crave Luxury Auto, one of the nation's premier marketers of high-line and luxury automobile dealers. The winner of this auction will have the opportunity to own this beautiful 1999 Ferrari 355 Fiorano Spider. The paint is in excellent condition and it is apparent that this car was garaged and meticulously-maintained. The interior is virtually flawless and is equipped with all the right options with only 16,545 miles. You can't go wrong with this fabulous vehicle! The ultimate expression of the revolutionary F355, this is Serial No. 60 of 100 Ferrari F355 limited-edition Serie Fiorano Spiders built in 1999. Ferrari’s stature as the maker of the world’s most coveted sports cars was under serious challenge in the early 1990s, but the company reversed its fortunes in dramatic fashion with the F355 unveiled in the spring of 1994. This all-new mid-engined design bore more than a passing resemblance to its 348 predecessor, but the similarities were only skin deep; beneath the surface was an all-new and stunning performer that set a new standard for Ferrari performance. The F355’s longitudinally mounted 3.5L V-8 engine was a completely new design employing highly sophisticated 5-valve cylinder heads, titanium connecting rods and highly tuned intake and exhaust systems to aid in reaching the F355’s outlandish 8,500 RPM redline and 375 HP output. The final rendition of the F355 was the 1999 Serie Fiorano, limited to only 100 examples. This very exclusive Ferrari drew heavily from the famed Competizione versions of 1995, using that model’s suspension that included firmer calibrations in the springs and electronically controlled shock absorbers, a larger-diameter sway bar, cross-drilled brake rotors and painted calipers with racing brake pads, Challenge rear grilles and Scuderia Ferrari cloisonné fender shields. Exclusive interior features included carbon-fiber shifter paddles and trim pieces, an Alcantara-covered steering wheel and a silver dash plaque declaring this example as No. 60 in Serie Fiorano production. This Serie Fiorano No. 60 is traditionally finished in Nero with a Burgandy interior. It is equipped with Ferrari’s fabulous paddle-shifted F1 automatic transmission and a folder full of the service history, Original books, and Ferrari car cover accompanies this rare 355 Fiorano Spider. Title: Ferrari 430 Berlinetta

Description: 1985 Ferrari 308 GTS Quattrovalvole Exceptional Ferrari 308 GTSi Quattrovalve in rare Fly Yellow over Crema Leather! From the previous owner of 19 years, it has been beautiful kept and maintained! Only 1,500 miles on last cam belt service completed in 2015, and absolutely ready to enjoy! Sweet investment for anyone looking for a final year 308 Targa Roof Ferrari! The Pininfarina-designed Ferrari 308 was a brilliantly modeled style that combined details of earlier successes to create an iconic shape easily recognizable buy all car enthusiasts today. With a stellar wedge shape, tube chassis, transversely-mounted 2927cc V8 with dual overhead camshafts, 5-speed fully synchromesh gate-shifted transaxle, 4-wheel independent suspension, 4-wheel ventilated disc brakes, front & rear anti-sway bars, rack & pinion steering, and limited slip differential, Ferrari put a potent machine on the streets that was quite sexy, but one that would endure an 11-year production run through 1985! Although, none equal to the next, improvements year-to-year would make the latter production units highly desirable. The carburetors were abandoned in 1980 in lieu of the favored Bosch K-Jetronic Fuel Injection system. By 1982, the valve train gained Quattrovalvole status to support 32-valve technology (4-valves per cylinder) to improve much needed horsepower & torque performance. Offered in both Berlinetta (GTB) and Spyder(GTS) designs, the final year production 1985 Ferrari 308 Quattrovalve is one of the strongest investments in the Ferrari collector market today! Make no mistake about the opportunity such an icon; the visual appearance, ease of maintenance, and overall driving pleasure! We are very pleased to offer this 1985 Ferrari 308 GTSi finished in very rare, factory code correct FER-102- Fly Yellow with Crema Beige Leather interior accented with black piping! Not only unique by color, this particular example was hand-picked by the General Motors Engineering Center/GM Corporation based in Warren, MI to be studied under the Chevrolet/Pontiac/Canada Group who purchased it from the Sports Car Exchange, Inc. in Dearborn, Michigan on April 23rd, 1985 with 1,080 miles already registered on the odometer. It would stay in their possession until February 1992 and sold officially to its first registered owner with approximately 26,000 miles. It would travel to the Minneapolis, Minnesota region with just owners since. The second of these lucky owners acquiring this Ferrari in August 1999 and brilliantly maintaining it ever since! Features include original Blaupunkt AM/FM/Cassette radio, air conditioning, Ferrari fender shields, 5-spoke light alloy wheels measuring 16”x7” up front and 16”x8” at the rear, BF Goodrich radial tires, leather wrapped Momo steering wheel, power windows, rear defrost, and more! Today, this stunning example shows only 43,870 miles on the odometer. All new front & rear suspension control arm bushings were fitted in June 2002 at 34,534 miles along with new engine rear main seal, clutch o-ring seal kit, and 4-wheel alignment by Donnybrooke Auto Service. It remains accident free, in superb condition with one exterior repaint in 2004 by Precision Restoration & Paint, and otherwise all original. A new water pump was fitted in May 2007 by Donnybrooke Auto Service at 37,752 miles. The former owner of 19 years was passionate about proper cam belt and tensioner major services, completing them accordingly in 2003, 2009, and most recently in June 2015 at 42,300 miles by Morrie’s Maserati based in Minneapolis, MN. These services include cam cover gaskets, cam seals, all engine & differential fluids, valve adjustments, valve cover gaskets, distributor cap & support gaskets. Front brake pads where installed in July 2009, while new rear pads where just installed this month in 2018. The St. Louis Car Museum also serviced the air conditioning system and retrofitted it to R134a refrigerant, replaced the engine air filter, engine oil & filter, rear axle dust boots, added a battery charger for times of storage, and detailed the car throughout! Subtle enhancements include Euro-spec style aluminum foot pedals, polished aluminum shift knob, clear/amber front turn signal lenses, and custom rear valance panel surrounding the exhaust just wonderfully! This car will be sold with a clean CarFax report, original warranty booklet, owner’s manual, original pedal pads, original shift knob, Marelli mirror insert tabs, extra turn signal housings, turn signal lenses, previous cam belts for new owner inspection, spark plug extenders, and front license plate bracket. This presents a wonderful chance to own an exceptionally well maintained 308 GTSi in a striking color you will find nowhere else on the market! We invite inspections and offers.
